sentences: Luu on elävän kudoksen muodostama kovainen rakenne.
Hirviö söi luun ja säästi lihan.
context: The Finnish word 'luu' means bone in English. It is a common noun referring to the hard, rigid tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates. In Finnish, it's an inanimate object (common gender), and can appear in various forms such as plural 'luet', partitive 'luuta', genitive 'luiden', etc.
